New Records: Rohit Sharma scored the fastest century (131 off 63 balls) in an Indian World Cup match, breaking multiple records including the most sixes in international cricket.
Sharma became the most prolific Indian World Cup century scorer with his seventh century, and the third overall in ODI history.
Afghanistan's Hashmatullah Shahidi and Azmatullah Omarzai formed the second-highest partnership (121 runs) in World Cup history.
Key Match Events: India won the match by 8 wickets, their second consecutive victory in the World Cup.
Rohit Sharma's quick century set up India's dominant win.
Key wickets fell at crucial moments, including Azmatullah Omarzai's dismissal by Hardik Pandya and Hashmatullah Shahidi's lbw by Kuldeep Yadav.
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Rohit Sharma emphasized the importance of the win for momentum at the start of the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma highlighted the team's performance and the need to focus on controllable factors ahead of the next match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a flat track, challenging for both teams.
India's high-score victory showcased their batting strength.
